title: 112_s3687
content: The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to adjust grant costs and appropriations for the Lake Pontchartrain Basin Restoration Program. The Environmental Protection Agency Headquarters in Washington, D.C. is renamed the "William Jefferson Clinton Federal Building." The George Mahon Federal Building in Midland, Texas is renamed the "George H.W. Bush and George W. Bush United States Courthouse and George Mahon Federal Building." The Thomas P. O'Neill, Jr. Federal Building is also mentioned. The Federal building at 200 C Street Southwest in DC is renamed the "Thomas P. O'Neill, Jr. Federal Building." The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 do not apply to water transfers by North Texas Municipal Water District and Greater Texoma Utility Authority using closed conveyance systems from Lake Texoma to treatment facilities. The Secretary will convey the McKinney Lake National Fish Hatchery to the State of North Carolina for use in the state's fish and wildlife management program. The McKinney Lake National Fish Hatchery in North Carolina, located at 220 McKinney Lake Road in Richmond County, is a warmwater facility spread over 422 acres. The property will be conveyed to the State for use in fishery and wildlife resources management, with a reversion clause if used for other purposes. The property conveyed to the State for fishery and wildlife management must be maintained in the same or better condition. The Secretary can request the use of the property for aquatic resource propagation in cooperation with the Commission. The resources held in public trust are used to address specific restoration or recovery needs of the resource. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
